entries.definition: Criminal law: mistake in the blow—intent is aimed at one person but another is hit.
Spanish: lawyer or attorney-at-law; officer of the court with professional duties.
Unintended, unforeseen injurious occurrence; not ordinarily expected or reasonably anticipated.
Libel: speech absolutely immune from suit (e.g., congressional debates).
Action to transfer property wrongfully titled to the rightful owner; distinct from quieting of title.
Negotiable instruments: one who signs to lend their name without receiving value.
Ownership acquired by possession over time—public, peaceful, uninterrupted, in concept of owner.
New matter that, while admitting the complaint, bars recovery (Rule 6, Sec. 5).
Controversy over tenurial arrangements or farmworkers’ representation on agricultural land.
Land devoted to agriculture; not classified as mineral, forest, residential, commercial, or industrial.
From another source; extrinsic evidence to clarify a document’s meaning.
Statute authorizing release of public funds from the treasury.
Artistic objects made by hand; decorative work produced in quantity.
Ascaris lumbricoides infestation; transmission via fecally contaminated food/drink.
Value fixed by tax authorities for rate computation; not necessarily market value.
Wages awarded for work an employee would have done absent illegal dismissal.
Private document; not conclusive proof of filiation; evidences administration of sacrament.
1987 Constitution impeachment ground, in addition to other specified offenses.
Legislative act inflicting punishment without trial.
Remedial: clarifies pleadings to define issues and avoid surprise; aids case preparation.
Extorting value by threats of accusation or exposure; akin to extortion.
A person deficient in understanding (older usage in cases).
Generally not actionable except for actual wedding-related expenses; moral damages via Civil Code provisions.
Employee group suited to collective bargaining, balancing workers’ and employer’s interests.
Labor: employer is mere bystander in certification election, with limited exception.
Entity transporting persons or goods for hire or gratuitously.
Act or omission by which a party violates another’s right (Rules of Court).
Recorded movement and safekeeping of seized drugs/chemicals from seizure to presentation.
Bill of exchange drawn on a bank, payable on demand (NIL Sec. 185).
Intolerable employer conduct forces resignation; effectively an illegal dismissal.
Willful disobedience or conduct impeding justice and the court’s authority.
Body/substance of the crime; proof that a crime occurred and someone is responsible.
Device used to obtain money, goods, property, labor, or services on credit.
